comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Hand tinted slide - Great Hall pillar reliefs, rock cut temple built by Ramses II, 19th dynasty, (1303-1237 B.C. approx - dates differ on all sources) This Great Hall honors the Gods Amun Ra (Amon Re) and Re Horakhte, near Aswan, lower Nubia. In 1960s they were cut away from the rock face in large pieces, moved to higher ground and reassembled, saving them from rising water level, due to the Aswan Dam. other relief wall images, found here: oi.uchicago.edu/museum/collections/pa/breasted/sites.html From Breasted Expeditions to Egypt & Sudan in 1905-1906. Image of Hathor seen on side of column here - flat face, circular mouth, flip hairdo..nice color version of the pillar at link: www.grisel.net/abu_simbel.htm
